paper_abstract: Using the AutoGraphiX 2 system (AGX2), we study relations between graph invariants of the form lb(n) <= R circle plus i <= ub(n) where R denotes the Randic index of a graph G = (V, E), i another invariant among matching number mu and the index (or the maximum eigenvalue) lambda(1), circle plus denotes one of the four operations x, -, x, /, while lb(n) and ub(n) lower and upper bounding functions of the order n of the graph considered which are tight for all 71 (except possibly very small values due to border effects). Conjectures are obtained in 14 out of 16 cases, 6 of which are proved automatically, 7 are proved by hand and one remains open.
paper_title: Variable Neighborhood Search for Extremal Graphs.18. Conjectures and Results about the Randic Index
